basic_info.description: My name is Brandon Mizutani and I am a dedicated software developer based in Seattle, WA, with a robust background in advanced software development. Holding a Certificate in Advanced Software Development in Python from Code Fellows and a Bachelor of Arts in Asian Pacific Studies from Loyola Marymount University, I leverage my expertise to create innovative and efficient applications. My technical skills span across various languages and frameworks including Python, JavaScript, React, and Django. I recent, notable projects include developing an e-commerce storefront using React and Redux, a Django-based To-Do App focusing on secure login and task storage, and an e-commerce app named Insta Dealz. In my professional journey, I have contributed significantly as a Lead TA and Tutor at Code Fellows, assisting students with programming concepts and enhancing their technical proficiency. Passionate about coding, I continue to apply my knowledge to develop successful computer and mobile applications.

projects.title: Mad Library
projects.description: This is my final project for my 201 course at Code Fellows. We created a mvp entitled `Mad Librarians`, a website for the purpose of creating user stories. It contains fun stories with user input, allow saving said stories in local storage, creative logos and clickable pictures to those stories.

projects.title: Celestiality
projects.description: This is my final project for my 301 course at Code Fellows. We created an app entitled `Celestiality`. It is designed to consolidate all the astrological information on the web onto a single app.The user can enter their date of birth and based on their input they are presented with a beautifully rendered page that displays relevant information to that date. 5 APIâ€™s are used to display the user's daily horoscope, their zodiac sign, a historical event that happened on their day of birth. There is also a journal feature that the app will also store this information for them to access at a later date.

projects.title: Battle Stocks
projects.description: This is my 401 midterm python project entitled Battle Stocks. It was a project designed as a stock trade app, that prompted the user to enter commands to buy and/or sell stocks, withdraw and/or deposit money, and plot the purchased stocks on a graph. And I specifically made contributions to the user prompts, input  validations, unit tests, and colorama.

projects.title: Insta Dealz
projects.description: This is my 401 final python project entitled Insta Dealz. It was a project designed as an e-commerce app that would allow shoppers to purchase items from a variety of categories. The user would have their own profile, adding and deleting items from their cart. The user would be able to also have a search bar that would allow the user to search for their desired items from the library.

experience.title: Student/BA Asian Pacific Studies w/ a minor in Film/Television Studies
mainTech: BA Asian Pacific Studies w/ a minor in Film/Television Studies
